alert.note: Alert for Northern Herkimer (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 09 at 10:27PM EST until January 11 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT TO 3 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below to 35 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Herkimer County. * WHEN... For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 1 AM EST Tuesday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight Monday night to 3 PM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to lake effect snow and localized whiteout conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected late tonight into Monday, especially south of Route 28. The coldest wind chills will occur late Monday night into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
